chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert E Smith

records.addlTxt: Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point Supervision at Level 5 and All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Robert E Smith appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Robert E Smith.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on defense motion to modify bail.
Bail bond hearing proceeded.   Arguments heard by defense and the State. 
Court GRANTED  defense bail motion  to modify bail for reasons placed on the record
Defense in receipt of the State's Offer and request time to discuss with defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned to  Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD VIA EMAIL.
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference on 9-29-2022
Court is in trial on a different matter and ordered case adjourned.
Parties advised of the new date via email. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Scheduling Conference scheduled October 13, 2022 at 2:30pm.

Defendant Robert E Smith not in court, in custody. 
Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Robert E Smith.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Discussion held discover and defense motion for a bail bond hearing and request adjournment.. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert E Smith in court with attorney Glenn Oswald Givens.  Defendant Robert E Smith in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert E Smith appeared by video means.
Case in court for a status conference. Case following along with defendants other pending felony case, 2022CF2535. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Due to Court calendar, the 07/19/2022 status conference is rescheduled to 07/25/2022 at 1:30 p.m. parties notified.

Defendant Robert E Smith in court with attorney Glenn Oswald Givens.  Defendant Robert E Smith in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for projected guilty plea.  Court is advised by the parties of potential dismissal of this case, and the addition of new charges in case 22CF2535.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens in court, defendant Robert E Smith not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Defense requested a plea hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens in court, defendant Robert E Smith not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a bail bond hearing. Court granted defense's request. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Modification of Bail, filed
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, Filed

Defendant Robert E Smith in court by video with Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens who appears in person.  Defendant Robert E Smith in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Defendant Robert E Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with KLM
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Robert E Smith in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Robert E Smith in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert E Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Kies, Branch 46.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
